title: Archives engaged in tense back and forth with Trump's team over missing records
description: • Here's what experts say about whether Trump's document handling was criminal

title: Archives engaged in tense back and forth with Trump's team over missing records
Canadian city granted injunction to end trucker blockade at critical bridge to US
Watch: Astra's first-ever satellite launch for NASA ends in failure
description: Rocket startup Astra's latest unmanned launch, equipped with four satellites, suffered a malfunction during stage separation and tumbled out of control

title: Russia could invade Ukraine before Olympics end, intel suggests, as US officials ramp up warnings
Here's how Fox is covering the Canada protesters
description: For weeks, Fox has fawned over the Canadian truckers who have crippled downtown Ottawa as they protest vaccine mandates. CNN's Daniel Dale reports on the effects of this attention.

title: Opinion: Ukrainians aren't laughing now
description: On Monday, as Ukraine was bracing for a possible Russian invasion and another punishing Covid-19 wave, President Volodymyr Zelensky held an event on digital transformation which resembled something out of Apple founder Steve Jobs' playbook.

title: Why the LGBTQ community loves -- and will always love -- Whitney Houston
description: It was a performance that likely would've made Whitney Houston proud.

title: Webb telescope shares unexpected 'selfie,' first test images
description: The James Webb Space Telescope is setting up shop while it chills out a million miles from Earth.

title: Boy, 12, killed in Ireland after car he was driving collided with truck
description: A 12-year-old boy has died after the car he was driving collided with a truck in County Limerick, Ireland, early Friday morning, CNN affiliate Virgin Media News reported.

title: President walks bullied 11-year-old girl with Down syndrome to school
description: The President of North Macedonia walked an 11-year-old girl with Down syndrome to school after he heard she was being bullied.

title: Black FedEx driver allegedly shot at by White father and son says he sees similarities with Ahmaud Arbery case
description: A Black FedEx driver who says he was shot at by a White father and son while delivering packages in Mississippi "can definitely see the similarities" between his case and that of Ahmaud Arbery, the Black man who was chased and murdered in south Georgia.

title: At least 7 British citizens and 1 American being held by the Taliban
description: At least eight Westerners have been arrested by the Taliban in Afghanistan during different incidents in the last two months, CNN has learned, marking a sharp escalation of Taliban actions against Westerners living in the country.

title: What it was like for Peloton employees who lost their jobs this week
description: Late Monday night, some Peloton staffers noticed they were unable to access work productivity apps like Slack and Okta, which they used regularly on the job. Peloton's employees had been told about a scheduled maintenance window that might cause service outages, according to one employee, but that didn't stop others from bracing for the worst.

title: US could prosecute Russians in Kamila Valieva case, says USADA chief
description: The United States could prosecute Russian individuals allegedly involved in figure skater Kamila Valieva's doping case under the American Rodchenkov Anti-Doping Act (RADA), the head of the US Anti-Doping Agency (USADA), Travis Tygart, told CNN on Friday.

title: Africa 'on track' to control the Covid-19 pandemic, WHO says
description: African countries are on course to control the coronavirus and its emerging variants this year, the World Health Organization's regional head for the continent has said.

title: Birds with bigger brains may cope with climate crisis better, study suggests
description: Thousands of birds die each spring and fall when they collide with Chicago's skyscrapers, which lie on a major migration path between Canada and Latin America.

title: A European beauty spot few have heard of
description: Think of Slovenia's Julian Alps and two images often spring to mind -- the fairy-tale sight of Lake Bled and, if you're a winter-sports fan, the ski slopes of Kranjska Gora.

title: Liz Cheney wants Republicans to remember what they keep trying to forget
description: In the HBO series "The Leftovers," there is a group called the "Guilty Remnant" that seeks to remind people that 2% of the world's population suddenly disappeared. They dress in all white, smoke and generally make it impossible for people to forget what they once were -- before the departed.

title: Why Eileen Gu is fashion's dream model
description: For followers of freestyle skiing and fashion alike, the buzz surrounding Winter Olympian Eileen Gu at this year's Games has come as little surprise.

title: Former Press secretary finds Trump's 'odd' call gaps
description: Former White House press secretary Stephanie Grisham tells CNN's New Day that she finds the call gaps in Trump's records during January 6th "odd". Grisham further explains Trumps call practices that could lead to the missing records.

title: 'Inventing Anna' puts the accent in the wrong place, diluting Anna Delvey's story
description: "Inventing Anna" transforms a juicy real-life drama about a con artist among the influencer crowd into a fairly inert limited series, in part by giving almost equal weight to the reporter who broke the story. Shonda Rhimes caught lightning in a bottle for Netflix with "Bridgerton," but her latest creation is less likely to have tongues wagging.

title: Tottenham Hotspur ask fans to 'move on' from using 'anti-Semitic' Y-word
description: English Premier League side Tottenham Hotspur has told supporters it is time to "move on" from using the "Y-word" -- deemed anti-Semitic -- after conducting a review of the term among the club's fanbase.

title: Daughter uses Wordle score to save her mom from home intruder
description: A daughter became worried when her mother didn't send her usual Wordle update. She was being held hostage by a naked man, police said.

title: Why the striking Super Bowl stadium is three-quarters underground
Why the big table in Moscow? Macron refused a Russian Covid test
description: There's socially distanced, and then there's French President Emmanuel Macron sitting on the opposite end of an enormous table during talks with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin at the Kremlin on Monday.

title: Australia says koalas are now an endangered species in two states
description: Australia on Friday listed koalas along much of its east coast as endangered after the native marsupial's habitats were hit by prolonged drought, bushfires and developers cutting down trees.

title: James Harden traded to Philadelphia 76ers in blockbuster move as Ben Simmons heads to Brooklyn Nets
description: The NBA's trade deadline took place on Thursday, and fans were served some eye-catching deals.

title: Finnair's fancy new airline seats don't recline
description: Spacious, full of gadgets, and with infinite angles of recline as they sink down to a lie-flat bed: there's a reason why airplane business class seats are as pricey -- and cushy -- as they are.

title: Kanye West wants Billie Eilish to apologize for dissing Travis Scott. She says she didn't
description: Grammy-winning singer Billie Eilish has denied making a dig at Travis Scott during her recent concert, after Kanye West threatened to pull out of his Coachella headline gig if she didn't apologize to Scott.

title: 1,000-ton video screen hanging above Super Bowl field
description: At Super Bowl LVI on Sunday, both teams will be playing with more than 1,000 tons hanging over their heads.

title: France announces plans to build up to 14 nuclear reactors
description: France has announced plans to build up to 14 new nuclear reactors in a move that could help reduce greenhouse gas emissions and provide a buffer against volatile energy prices.

title: The fascinating - and sweaty - history of exercise
description: Christiane Amanpour speaks with Bill Hayes, author of "Sweat", on the origins of exercise from Plato and the first Olympic Games to Jane Fonda and modern day workouts

title: Their characters fell in love on screen. Now they're getting married in real life
description: South Korean celebrities Son Ye-jin and Hyun Bin announced their engagement on Thursday via Instagram. The pair starred in the global hit show "Crash Landing on You," which became one of the country's most-watched drama series after airing on Korean television and Netflix in 2019.

title: Russian anti-doping agency allowed Kamila Valieva to compete in Olympics despite failed drug test
description: The International Testing Agency (ITA) has confirmed that 15-year-old Kamila Valieva of the Russian Olympic Committee (ROC) failed a drug test taken in December, ahead of the Beijing 2022 Winter Olympics.

title: Americans think they're doomed
description: President Joe Biden often says America's best days are ahead. It just doesn't feel that way right now.

title: Beijing's cute Olympic mascot was a crowd favorite in China -- until it started talking
description: Beijing 2022's Olympic mascot, a playful panda wearing an icy shell, has been a crowd favorite at the Winter Games -- until it started talking.

title: Meet Anderson Cooper's new baby boy
description: Anderson Cooper announces the birth of his second son, Sebastian Luke Maisani-Cooper, with Benjamin Maisani.

title: The President tells Americans to leave now and warns that he will not send troops to rescue Americans
description: • What the US is watching that could signal a Russian invasion

title: What the US is watching that could signal a Russian invasion
description: It might be a cyberattack targeting Ukraine's energy grid. Or the movement of Russian battalions and tanks along the border and into firing range. Or perhaps even a long-range missile attack.

title: China clamps down on dissent during Games
description: As the Winter Games get underway in Beijing, global attention has turned to events in the extensive Olympic "bubble" -- a zone sealing off visiting athletes, media and participants from the rest of the host city to prevent the spread of Covid-19.

title: This pipeline could have an effect on national security all over Europe
description: CNN's Bianca Nobilo explains what the Nord Stream 2 pipeline is, and why it's a big deal in the Russia-Ukraine crisis.

title: Prince Charles tests positive for Covid for second time
description: Prince Charles is in isolation having tested positive for Covid-19, Clarence House has said.

title: Brush fire threatens homes and prompts evacuation orders in Laguna Beach, California
description: Residents in the Irvine Cove and Emerald Bay areas of Laguna Beach, California, are under an immediate evacuation order due to a brush fire, city officials said.

title: Man charged in Asian immigrant's 2021 killing in New York City
description: A man who allegedly assaulted a Chinese immigrant in New York City last year has been charged with murder in the second degree as a hate crime, Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg announced Thursday.

title: London police chief resigns amid series of scandals
description: London Metropolitan Police Commissioner Cressida Dick has resigned.

title: Vulnerable Democrats feel inflation squeeze and call for more White House action
description: American consumers are feeling the squeeze from inflation -- as are Senate Democrats facing voters in nine months.

title: Green Day frontman's classic car stolen and recovered; guitars and amp still missing, say police
description: Green Day frontman Billie Joe Armstrong's stolen classic car was recovered this week in Southern California, according to the Costa Mesa Police Department.

title: New satellite images show continuing Russian military build-up
description: New satellite images released by a US-based technology company appear to show continuing Russian military build-up in Crimea, western Russia and Belarus, as pressure continues to mount on Ukraine from three directions, underscoring fears that the Kremlin is planning an incursion into Ukrainian territory.

title: Texas national guardsmen say their mission to secure the border is a waste of time and resources
description: Since Texas Republican Gov. Greg Abbott deployed thousands of personnel to the US-Mexico border, the operation has been slammed as overtly political and a waste of resources by Democratic lawmakers and even some of the National Guard members participating in the mission.
